our_story.title: Our Story
story: In 2019, while traveling through New Zealand, Alex ended up working in the wine vineyards where he met a friendly German guy — spoiler alert: Madeline’s brother. The two hit it off, and the invitation was casually extended: if Alex ever found himself in Germany, he should drop by. On his way back to Canada, Alex made a spontaneous detour to Europe to visit his new friend in Germany and another buddy in the Netherlands.

While staying with the family in Germany, Alex met Madeline — and it quickly became clear there was something special between them. After leaving, they kept in touch, exchanging voice messages constantly while Alex was working as a spray plane ground crew member in Saskatchewan. The early mornings gave them more time to talk before the time difference pulled them apart each day.

As their connection deepened, Alex booked a return trip to Germany — this time just to see Madeline. They spent three unforgettable weeks road-tripping through Austria, passing the ultimate relationship test: traveling together nonstop. Not only were they not sick of each other, but by the end of the trip, they decided to give a long-distance relationship a real shot (even if Alex initially said, “Let’s not put a label on it” — classic move).

After another tough goodbye, Alex returned to Canada and jumped back into oil rig work to save up quickly. Then Madeline made a bold move — visiting him in February — in Saskatchewan — where temperatures regularly drop below -40°C. She stayed with him through the freezing cold and long days on the rig, happy just to be together. That’s when Alex knew she was truly serious.

Her flight back was canceled as COVID hit, and while part of Alex hoped she might stay longer, they both knew she had to return. That time together solidified their plans: Alex would move to Germany, and they’d build a life together. That was back in 2020, and they haven’t looked back since — despite the challenges of adjusting to a new country, culture, and language.
After all the years of distance, hard goodbyes, and heartfelt reunions, Alex and Madeline are thrilled to finally say 'I do' and begin the next chapter — together, for good.
our_story.quote: True love is like wildflowers... it's often found in the most unlikely places.

reception.title: Reception
reception.description: Join us for dinner, dancing, and celebration under the tent near the ceremony site. Guests will have full access to the surrounding area for lawn games and mingling. Cocktail hour will begin immediately following the ceremony. Learn more about the venue at

paulushaus.header: Paulushaus Neuwirth - Lodging at the venue
paulushaus.description: Group-style retreat house perfect for larger self-catering groups. Kitchen, outdoor area with sports/playground, basic amenities. No restaurant. ~0 km from venue; ~4 km to city center. Free parking.
paulushaus.info: The venue is 4 km from town, so transport will be needed to get there and back. Taxis are available if you haven’t rented a car. There’s also a nearby bus stop within walking distance if you prefer public transport.

hotelRemspark.description: Modern 4-star hotel near the city center. Fitness area, rooftop restaurant/bar, breakfast buffet. ~7–8 km to venue. On-site paid parking. Bike rentals at cost and Wi-Fi.

hotelSchwaebischGmuend.description: Comfortable 4-star hotel with wellness area (pool, sauna, fitness), breakfast buffet, and regional cuisine. ~6–7 km to venue. Garage parking (~€10/day). Right near train station.

schoenblick.description: Peaceful guesthouse with forest surroundings. Breakfast included, basic amenities, park grounds, and free parking. ~1–2 km to venue; ~2.5 km to city center.

mutlangerHof.description: Simple and quiet guesthouse in Mutlangen. Free Wi-Fi, continental breakfast, and bike rental. ~5 km to venue; ~3.5 km to city center. Free parking on site.

transportation.title: Transportation
transportation.description: The nearest major cities with international airports to the wedding venue are Stuttgart, Frankfurt, and Munich (München). Stuttgart Airport (STR) is closer and more convenient, but Frankfurt Airport (FRA) and Munich Airport (MUC) are also good options with more international flight availability.
transportation.notice1: From either airport, you have three main options for getting to the region:

train.title: Train
train.description: All three airports have train connections to Schwäbisch Gmünd, the nearest city to the venue. You may need to transfer once, typically in Stuttgart or Göppingen, depending on the route.

carRental.title: Car Rental
carRental.description: Renting a car is a convenient option and allows flexibility, especially if you're staying in the countryside or want to explore the region. Highways connect all three airports to Schwäbisch Gmünd (approx. 45 minutes from Stuttgart, 2.5 hours from Frankfurt, and 2.5 hours from Munich).

venueDetails.description: Once you arrive in Schwäbisch Gmünd, the wedding venue is located in a nearby rural area approximately 4 km outside the city.
venueDetails.notice1: From Schwäbisch Gmünd, you can reach the venue and surrounding areas in several ways:

bus.title: Bus
bus.description: Local bus 72 stop near the venue. The bus stop is called Lindach, Paulushaus. *Please inform the bus driver where you want to get off and they should be able to ensure you get off at the correct spot.

taxi.title: Taxi
taxi.description: Taxis are available at the train station and around the city. You can contact the following taxi services:

car.title: Car
car.description: If you're staying outside the city or have a rental, driving is the most flexible option. Parking is available at the venue and most accommodations.

venueDetails.planningReminder: Please plan accordingly depending on your arrival airport and whether you’ll be using public transport or a rental car. We’re happy to help coordinate if you’re unsure!
